meanings.sent1: She knew her actions would foredoom her chances of success.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller seemed to foredoom his future with her ominous predictions.
meanings.sent3: His habit of procrastination would foredoom his chances of finishing the project on time.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky seemed to foredoom a storm approaching.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen intuition seemed to foredoom the suspect's alibi.

meanings.definition: To predestine to an unhappy fate.
meanings.sent1: The ancient prophecy seemed to foredoom the kingdom to destruction.
meanings.sent2: The curse was said to foredoom anyone who dared to enter the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The broken mirror was believed to foredoom seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent4: The old legend foredoomed the village to be forever haunted by the ghostly apparition.
meanings.sent5: The witch's spell seemed to foredoom the prince to eternal slumber.
